body_html:
I am using nvidia-docker and the latest everything on RHEL 7.2 and I still have this issue.

manju@o185i089:/lvol/manju$ docker run -it gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-devel-gpu
Unable to find image 'gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-devel-gpu' locally
latest-devel-gpu: Pulling from tensorflow/tensorflow
759d6771041e: Pull complete
8836b825667b: Pull complete
c2f5e51744e6: Pull complete
a3ed95caeb02: Pull complete
d5b215eff347: Pull complete
34d39ef2e894: Pull complete
a7a36155eb9e: Pull complete
b1bfa35e6e17: Pull complete
8210f508bb7c: Pull complete
fd02f6ca3839: Pull complete
c7e296ba93f3: Pull complete
7b9159cc5928: Pull complete
25abb1637a5a: Pull complete
71595b8a5fcb: Pull complete
00fa70dea9b1: Pull complete
4c3f9ea22d7e: Pull complete
077e0cee8ca6: Pull complete
65b6e5754aad: Pull complete
0811f4c80537: Pull complete
e0a07be9804b: Pull complete
c8e3ab48d3ab: Pull complete
cc5ff4523b24: Pull complete
Digest: sha256:a38c40a95869d8e36380f88bb0682c77988d12cefd28d4e161093049a4bbb4b5
Status: Downloaded newer image for gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-devel-gpu
root@40afc612354b:~#
root@40afc612354b:~#
root@40afc612354b:~# python
Python 2.7.6 (default, Jun 22 2015, 17:58:13)
[GCC 4.8.2] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow as tf
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:105] successfully opened CUDA library libcublas.so locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:105] successfully opened CUDA library libcudnn.so locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:105] successfully opened CUDA library libcufft.so locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:99] Couldn't open CUDA library libcuda.so.1. LD_LIBRARY_PATH: /usr/local/nvidia/lib:/usr/local/nvidia/lib64:
I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:121] hostname: 40afc612354b
I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:146] libcuda reported version is: Not found: was unable to find libcuda.so DSO loaded into this program
I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:257] driver version file contents: """NVRM version: NVIDIA UNIX x86_64 Kernel Module 352.93 Tue Apr 5 18:18:24 PDT 2016
GCC version: gcc version 4.8.5 20150623 (Red Hat 4.8.5-4) (GCC)
"""
I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:150] kernel reported version is: 352.93
I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_gpu_executor.cc:1051] LD_LIBRARY_PATH: /usr/local/nvidia/lib:/usr/local/nvidia/lib64:
I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_gpu_executor.cc:1052] failed to find libcuda.so on this system: Failed precondition: could not dlopen DSO: libcuda.so.1; dlerror: libcuda.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:105] successfully opened CUDA library libcurand.so locally
>>>

Is there a fix for this issue ?

I am using nvidia-docker and the latest everything on RHEL 7.2 and I still have this issue.
manju@o185i089:/lvol/manju$ docker run -it gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-devel-gpu
Unable to find image 'gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-devel-gpu' locally

"""

I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:105] successfully opened CUDA library libcurand.so locally
>>>
Is there a fix for this issue ?
body:
I am using nvidia-docker and the latest everything on RHEL 7.2 and I still have this issue.

`manju@o185i089:/lvol/manju$ docker run -it gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-devel-gpu`
`Unable to find image 'gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-devel-gpu' locally`
`latest-devel-gpu: Pulling from tensorflow/tensorflow`
`759d6771041e: Pull complete`
`8836b825667b: Pull complete`

`Status: Downloaded newer image for gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-devel-gpu`
`root@40afc612354b:~#`
`root@40afc612354b:~#`
`root@40afc612354b:~# python`
`Python 2.7.6 (default, Jun 22 2015, 17:58:13)`
`[GCC 4.8.2] on linux2`
`Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.`
`>>> import tensorflow as tf`
`I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:105] successfully opened CUDA library libcublas.so locally`
`I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:105] successfully opened CUDA library libcudnn.so locally`
`I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:105] successfully opened CUDA library libcufft.so locally`
`I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:99] Couldn't open CUDA library libcuda.so.1. LD_LIBRARY_PATH: /usr/local/nvidia/lib:/usr/local/nvidia/lib64:`
`I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:121] hostname: 40afc612354b`
`I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:146] libcuda reported version is: Not found: was unable to find libcuda.so DSO loaded into this program`
`I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:257] driver version file contents: """NVRM version: NVIDIA UNIX x86_64 Kernel Module  352.93  Tue Apr  5 18:18:24 PDT 2016`
`GCC version:  gcc version 4.8.5 20150623 (Red Hat 4.8.5-4) (GCC)`
`"""`
`I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:150] kernel reported version is: 352.93`
`I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_gpu_executor.cc:1051] LD_LIBRARY_PATH: /usr/local/nvidia/lib:/usr/local/nvidia/lib64:`
`I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_gpu_executor.cc:1052] failed to find libcuda.so on this system: Failed precondition: could not dlopen DSO: libcuda.so.1; dlerror: libcuda.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory`
`I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:105] successfully opened CUDA library libcurand.so locally`
`>>>`

Is there a fix for this issue ?
